Row.Text: Your culture has overawed my coarse and barbaric people. Our culture will be ground to dust under the weight of your mighty influence, however others surely remain who will contest your dominance.

I lament that the traditions of my ancestors are being swept away by the powerful force of your influence. Is this the beginning of an age of cultural darkness, or are you the bringer of enlightenment?
We were once a proud, independent culture, but now all that remains of our former glory rests on dusty shelves. Someday you too will join us in the archives of history ... but today is not that day.

I am happy to see that you have finally abandoned your miserable, barbaric customs. Do not despair, as it is far better for a culture to die by choice than by the sword ... though yours, perhaps, may succumb to both.
Do not fear the new way of life that has enthralled your people. You will soon forget all about the backwards and rude traditions you laughably called 'culture.'

There is little space now for the diverse traditions of bygone eras. Unfortunately for you, it seems that your culture has been pushed out. Don't worry, I plan on dedicating a large section of our new antiquities museum to you.

This world is not big enough for two would-be conquerors. Though I see that you are on the warpath, I do not fear you or your power. My armies will meet yours on the battlefield soon enough, a challenge that will forever decide the fate of humanity. I can only hope that such a conflict will not destroy us both. Prepare yourself!

Do you hear the footsteps of my armies? Fear me, and fear them, as there cannot be two world conquerors on this day. I seek a place in the sun, an empire that streches around the world. Unfortunately for you, your army stands in my way. Not for long.

You will soon bend your knee to my silver-tongued diplomats. I've watched your petty envoys and bureaucrats attempt to seize control of the World Congress for some time now, but I will tolerate it no longer. Global hegemony shall be mine!

You'll be happy to know that I've just finished revising my acceptance speech for the position of 'Supreme Leader of Earth.' I do hope you'll attend the reception, as I've reserved you a place at my side. I think.

I received a shipment of your so-called 'cultural artifacts' the other day. How quaint. While you may have swayed a few lesser cultures to your side, you will all soon know the meaning of true culture. Prepare for an onslaught, not of firepower, but of my cultural superiority!

I know you will agree that there are few sights as glorious as that of a foreign army conquering a city full of willing, passive citizens, especially when that army is composed of musicians, artists, and other cultural luminaries. Unfortunately for you, there is only room for one cultural conqueror on this planet. Prepare to be enlightened.

Though we both stare into the night sky and dream of interstellar empire, historians will remember only one of us for being the first to accomplish such a great task: me. Do not fret, as our mutual love of science need not lead to war. In fact, how would you like a seat on our first spaceship? Being a footnote of history is better than not being remembered at all, right?

We shall soon slip the surly bonds of Earth and pierce the heavens in our shiny new rockets. I'm sorry, by 'we' I meant my people, not yours. We shall be the first to Alpha Centauri, this I can promise you. If you insist on racing us, I'll give you this advice: make sure the pointy end of your rocket is facing upwards.
I have no idea what you are up to, or what kind of mark you are trying to make on history, but know this: we're watching you, and we have our own plans. And they're probably better than yours. Maybe.

One of my historians came by the other day to ask me about you and your impact on world history. Do you want to know what I told him? Nothing, and not for a lack of trying. What are you doing over there, anyways? Feeling a bit listless, maybe?
